title: How to find the recorded file of the replay
body: Hello! guys and girls. The replay system is only available on this patch. So, i wanted to know after recording a replay for a match where does the recording file save itself? I mean how will i upload somewhere once i record the replay? Ty.

replies.body: As *saycheese369* mentioned, they're stored in the *League of Legends* folder in **Documents/My Documents** on your computer. You should be able to find the files there no problem, so long as you've recorded some highlights or downloaded the replay from your Match History on the Beta Client.

Thank you for the reply. But you know when u watch your replay, you cant lock the camera, it just move around. I cant only fit the camera as my champ move. The camera either stay in on side or It moves around itself. Any solution for that?

You can actually lock the camera on any champ by entering manual camera mode (Hit the **S** key) then select the champ you want to stay locked to in the dropdown menu for Manual Mode. I've included screenshots below to visually assist you.

(Click to enlarge)

https://imgur.com/a/4x3uC

Let me know if this helped!
Not helpful :P. If I do that the camera lock in 1 spot and i need to move the camera by myself. I want the camera to move by itself automatically as my champ move.

If you select your own champion (you name) from the dropdown list, it should automatically move with your champ. I tested this and that's how it worked on my computer. Maybe I'm poorly explaining how this works. :|
